Uses of Display in ej.microui.io
 

Methods in ej.microui.io that return Display
static Display[] Display.getAllDisplays()
          Returns all available displays.
static Display Display.getDefaultDisplay()
          Returns the default display of the system.
 Display Image.getDisplay()
          Returns the display associated with the image.
 Display GraphicsContext.getDisplay()
          Returns the display associated with the GraphicsContext.
 Display Displayable.getDisplay()
          Returns the displayable's display which is never null.
 Display FlyingImage.getDisplay()
          Returns the display associated to the FlyingImage.
 

Methods in ej.microui.io with parameters of type Display
static Image Image.createImage(Display d, byte[] imageData, int imageOffset, int imageLength, int imageFormat)
          Creates an immmutable image from a byte array for the given display.
static Image Image.createImage(Display d, java.io.InputStream stream, int imageFormat)
          Creates an immutable image from an InputStream.
static Image Image.createImage(Display d, int[] argbData, int offset, int scanlength, int width, int height, boolean processAlpha)
          Creates an immutable image from an int array of pixels for the specified display.
Each pixel value is stored in 0xAARRGGBB format, where the high-order byte contains the alpha channel and the remaining bytes contain color components for red, green and blue, respectively.
static Image Image.createImage(Display d, int width, int height)
          Creates a new mutable image for the given display and with the given size.
static Image Image.createImage(Display d, java.lang.String name, int imageFormat)
          Creates an immutable image from a resource for the given display.
 void Pointer.setScale(Display display)
          Sets a display area for scaled area.
same as setScale(display.getWidth(), display.getHeight())
 

Constructors in ej.microui.io with parameters of type Display
Displayable(Display display)
          The newly created displayable is built for the given Display and is hidden.
